definition: paternal aunt/husband's sister/husband's mother (old)/nun/for the time being (literary)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: My younger sister. Look at your dirty face.
sentences.chinese: 我的小姑子呀，你看这小脸花的。

sentences.english: Uncles son thought that his wife to her meal delivery to people , and ate.
sentences.chinese: 小姑子还以为是自己嫂子让人给她送饭来的，就吃了。

sentences.english: I would rather do Gu son than in the future live a similar to my Niang day.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿做了姑子，也不愿将来过着和我娘一样的日子。

sentences.english: Her sister and sister-in-law get along better than real sisters.
sentences.chinese: 姐姐和小姑子的感情比亲生姐妹还要好。

sentences.english: Delude, receive this son of aunt Niu and husband's younger sister to enter house to sit.
sentences.chinese: 惑，招呼着这位牛姨妈和小姑子进屋里坐。

sentences.english: My sister-in-law Carol stood framed in the doorway with a large bowl clutched in her hands.
sentences.chinese: 我的小姑子卡罗尔站在门口，手里端着一个大碗。

sentences.english: She's a first-rate sister-in-law, a great cook, witty and also kind.
sentences.chinese: 她真是第一等的小姑子，厨艺一流，机智友好。
莫小贝是佟湘玉的小姑子。

definition: wife of mother's brother/aunt/maternal uncle's wife
adoptive mother (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
(dialect) form of address for one's wife/polite form of address for a woman
grandfather's sister/sister of a woman's father-in-law
